item.title: Stock Market Live: Nifty Enters Correction Zone; Nifty IT Surges 2% After TCS Q3 Result - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Market Live: Nifty In Correction Zone; Nifty IT Bucks Trend To Surge 2%, PSU Banks Under Pressure

Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Nifty has fallen into a correction zone, indicating a decline of over 10% from its 52-week high, as Sensex decreases by 0.4%.

  • Nifty faces challenges as it drops to correction levels, raising concerns for investors.
  • Nifty IT sector shows resilience with a 2% increase amid broader market declines.
  • Pressure on PSU banks is evident, with significant drop in stock prices among major players.
"The market is currently experiencing significant volatility, which may lead to a reevaluation of investment strategies among traders."

This market phase highlights the tension between sector performance, particularly the strength of IT stocks compared to the broader market instabilities.

item.title: TCS share price soars over 4% on robust Q3 results, $10.2 billion order book and dividend announcement - Upstox
item.description:
TCS Shares Surge Over 4% Following Strong Q3 Results and Dividend Announcement

Publication Date: Not specified   |   Source: Not specified

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) shares saw a significant increase of over 4% after announcing its Q3 results along with a dividend declaration.

The key highlights from the article are as follows:

  • TCS share price increased by 4.6% to ₹4,225 on the NSE.
  • Consolidated post-tax profit reached ₹12,380 crore, marking an 11.95% increase YoY.
  • Revenue from operations was ₹63,973 crore, a 5.59% rise YoY.
  • New order bookings hit USD 10.2 billion, up significantly from USD 7.9 billion last year.
  • A dividend of ₹76 per equity share was declared.
  • CEO K Krithivasan expressed confidence in future growth despite market challenges.
  • TCS workforce decreased by over 5,000 employees, with an attrition rate of 13%.
“We are pleased with the excellent TCV performance in Q3... give us confidence for the future,” - K Krithivasan, CEO TCS

This strong performance and positive outlook underscore TCS's resilience and growth potential in the IT services sector.

item.title: Tata Elxsi shares may continue to underperform, says this analyst post Q3 results - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Tata Elxsi Shares Drop 8% Amid Analyst Downgrades

Publication Date: January 10, 2025

Source: CNBC TV18

Tata Elxsi Ltd. shares fell by 8% following disappointing quarterly results and price target reductions from analysts.

  • Shares dropped due to price target cuts after underwhelming December quarter results.
  • Net profit decreased by 13% QoQ, totaling ₹199 crore.
  • Revenue dipped 1.7% QoQ to ₹939 crore, with a notable decline in the media and communications unit.
  • Morgan Stanley downgraded the stock to 'Underperform' and lowered the price target to ₹6,000.
  • Only 3 out of 14 analysts rated the stock as a 'Buy', while 11 issued 'Sell' ratings.
Morgan Stanley noted, "Weakness in European transportation continues, and a significant recovery in media and healthcare remains elusive."

The significant drop in Tata Elxsi's stock price, alongside analysts' cautious outlook, raises concerns over its future performance.

item.title: Stock Market LIVE: Benchmarks turn green; Sensex climbs 150 pts to 77,750; Nifty at 23,550; IT up 3% - Business Standard
item.description:
Stock Market LIVE Updates: Sensex flat at 77,630; Nifty at 23,500; IT up 3%; Broader mkts decline

Date: January 10, 2025, Source: Business Standard

Indian benchmark equity indices BSE Sensex and Nifty50 experienced a decline on January 10, 2025, amidst global market uncertainties.

  • The BSE Sensex was down by 133.54 points, trading at 77,486.67.
  • The Nifty50 dropped by 64.70 points, settling at 23,461.80.
  • Only seven stocks on the Sensex gained while others, including TCS and Tech Mahindra, saw losses.
  • Sector-wise, the IT index positively performed with a 2% increase, while most other sectors declined around 1%.
  • The Indian economy is projected to grow by 6.6% in 2025, as reported by the UN.
  • Foreign institutional investors sold Indian equities worth ₹7,170.87 crores, while domestic investors bought equities worth ₹7,639.63 crores.
“The excess earnings of unlisted companies are at a record level, the highest interest-coverage ratio since 1990-91.”

The Indian stock market faces challenges due to international trends and ongoing selling by foreign institutional investors.

item.title: Fastest growing and declining job roles by 2030 as per WEF, all you need to know - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Fastest Growing and Declining Job Roles by 2030 as per WEF

Date: Jan 10, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The World Economic Forum (WEF) predicts significant changes in job roles by 2030, highlighting both job growth and declines across various sectors.

  • 170 million new jobs will be created, while 92 million will be displaced, resulting in a net increase of 78 million jobs.
  • Big data specialists, FinTech engineers, and AI & machine learning specialists are among the top 3 fastest growing job roles.
  • Postal service clerks, bank tellers, and data entry clerks are projected to be the top 3 declining job roles.
  • Technological advancements and digital access are key drivers of growth in job roles.
  • Farmworkers are expected to see a significant increase of 35 million jobs by 2030 due to green transition trends.
“Farmworkers top the list of the largest growing job roles in the next five years and are expected to see 35 million more jobs by 2030.”

This report serves as a crucial insight into the evolving landscape of employment opportunities and challenges, urging individuals and organizations to prepare for these changes.

item.title: L&T chairman SN Subrahmanyan paid ₹51 crore as salary in FY24, while median salary of employees was… - Hindustan Times
item.description:
L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan's ₹51 Crore Salary Sparks Outrage

Published on: Jan 10, 2025 | Source: The New Indian Express

Larsen & Toubro chairman SN Subrahmanyan earned a total salary of ₹51 crore in FY24, which is 534.57 times the median salary of employees at the company.

  • Subrahmanyan's remuneration included a base salary of ₹3.6 crore, ₹1.67 crore in prerequisites, and ₹35.28 crore in commission.
  • His retirement benefits totaled ₹10.5 crore.
  • He is facing backlash for suggesting employees work 90 hours a week.
  • His comments have been criticized by celebrities and social media users, highlighting the disparity between his salary and that of average employees.
  • The median salary for L&T employees was ₹9.55 lakh in FY24, compared to Subrahmanyan's ₹51 crore.
  • His salary increased by 43.11% from the previous year.
  • L&T defended his remarks by stating that extraordinary outcomes require extraordinary efforts.
“If I can make you work on Sundays, I will be more happy, because I work on Sundays.” - SN Subrahmanyan

The salary disparity and Subrahmanyan's remarks raise significant questions about work-life balance and corporate culture at L&T.

item.title: Meta’s fact-checking decision sets off alarm bells in India - The Economic Times
item.description:
Meta’s Fact-Checking Decision Sets Off Alarm Bells in India

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Economic Times

Meta's recent decision to eliminate third-party fact-checking in the US in favor of a community-based model has raised alarms about the potential spread of misinformation, especially in diverse markets like India.

  • Meta will now rely on user-generated content for fact-checking, following the community notes model popularized by Twitter.
  • Experts warn this change may exacerbate misinformation and disinformation on Meta platforms.
  • Prominent voices, including Phil Bloomer and Angie Drobnic Holan, express concern over the implications for accurate information in social media.
  • The decision is perceived as a reaction to political pressures and is likely to extend to other regions, including India.
  • In India, a transition away from established fact-checking could have severe consequences, given the country's diversity and reliance on accurate content.
“India is a diverse country and with diversity, the understanding of the same situation or content could vary.” - Pratishtha Arora

This strategic shift by Meta indicates potential risks for information integrity globally, as it may set a precedent for other countries.

item.title: HSBC downgrades Indian markets to 'neutral', cuts Sensex target by 5,000 points - CNBCTV18
item.description:
HSBC Downgrades Indian Markets to 'Neutral', Cuts Sensex Target by 5,000 Points

Date: January 9, 2025 | Source: CNBC TV18

HSBC has downgraded Indian stock markets to a 'neutral' stance and reduced its Sensex target, indicating a shift in market sentiment.

  • HSBC has cut its 2025-end Sensex target to 85,990 from 90,520, suggesting a 10% upside from current levels.
  • The downgrade follows a noticeable slowdown in profits and elevated valuations.
  • HSBC maintains an 'overweight' stance on Chinese markets, with specific upgrades across Hong Kong and South Korea.
  • The firm notes that growth estimates for the Nifty 50 have been reduced significantly.
  • Despite the downgrade, India remains the strongest growth story among emerging markets.
"As earnings disappoint, consensus has cut its financial year 2025 growth estimates for the Nifty 50 to 5% from 15% earlier." - HSBC

The downgrade from HSBC indicates a cautious outlook for Indian markets amidst rising challenges, yet underscores the potential for future recovery driven by rural demand.
